# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    lines = []
    
    for word in words
        if length(word) > text_width
            error("Word '$word' exceeds the maximum text width of $text_width characters")
        end

        # If adding the next word exceeds the text width,
        # push the current line and start a new one
        if length(lines[end]) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, lines[end])
            setindex!(lines, "", end)
        end

        # Append the current word to the last line
        append!(lines[end], word)

        # If the current word was followed by a space,
        # add an empty string to the lines array so we don't lose the line break
        if endswith(word, ' ') && length(lines[end]) == text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
    end

    return join(lines, "\n"))
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
text = "This function will wrap words into lines"
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

Output:

```
This function will wrap
words into lines
```
